title: [5.0.11rc1] ambiguous error when two users edit shared file at same time
body:
expected behavior
better error handling

actual behavior
error stating â€œfailed to save fileâ€?

steps to reproduce

-- create a text file and share it
-- have 2 users open the text file at the same time on the owncloud web interface
-- user1 â€“ the owner of the shared file â€“ edits the file and saves it
-- user2 also edits the file and attempts to save.  since the file was just saved by user1, user2 gets an error:

 
![error_1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/1052800/8d2d59e0-10e3-11e3-9289-bc1c72091f64.png)


this error gives no indication as to why the file cannot be saved.  it is ambiguous and the user doesnâ€™t know what to do at this time.

-- the same thing happens if user2 edits the file and saves prior to user1 saving the file.
-- if user2 edits the file and saves first, an etmp file is created in the share directory:

![err0r2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/1052802/93c0983a-10e3-11e3-8345-25d2e5cd0098.png)



 

-- if user1 attempts to open the etmp file, he gets the following owncloud error:


![error3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/1052805/9cfccc5c-10e3-11e3-8071-2f79ae6686a5.png)




 
user1 can not delete the file either.

-- if user2 opens the etmp file, he gets the following:


![error4](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/1052806/a4107264-10e3-11e3-93e9-87a9c0c268c2.png)


 

user2 can delete the file
